message.content:
cs.IT, cs.CC, cs.DS, cs.SI, cs.NI. 

The paper focuses on the construction and evaluation of polar codes, which are a type of error-correcting code used in information theory. Therefore, cs.IT (Information Theory) is the most likely sub-category. The paper also involves the use of binary linear codes and trellis representations, which are topics commonly studied in cs.CC (Computational Complexity) and cs.DS (Data Structures and Algorithms). Additionally, the paper discusses the complexity of the codes and their performance on the binary erasure channel, which could fall under cs.SI (Social and Information Networks) or cs.NI (Networking and Internet Architecture).
